result.execSummary:
The Governor of the State of Wisconsin has issued a pardon to the defendant for one or more of the charge(s) for which there was a conviction in this case. Although a pardon does not vacate or set aside a conviction, it does have the effect of restoring to the defendant all of the civil rights that would otherwise be lost as a result of the conviction. Please check the court record events to determine the precise charge(s) to which the pardon applies.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Must provide a DNA sample.
Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision and DNA fees prior to the end of probation. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.
Maintain full time/part time employment and/or schooling.
As a convicted felon defendant shall never be in possession of any firearms or weapons; and shall not vote until civil rights are restored.
No contact with the codefendant Michael R. Guerra or the address at 345 S. 116 Street, in the City of West Allis, Milwaukee County, WI.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

records.addlTxt: Governor of the State of Wisconsin, Tony Evers, DOES FULLY AND UNCONDITIONALLY PARDON Matthew Bittman of the offense described in this case and restores to him/her all the rights and privileges which may have been forfeited as a result of said offense.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew John Bittmann in court with attorney Adam C Essling.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve 1 YEAR in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work and treatment.  

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS with the following conditions as to probation:
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees prior to the end of probation. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment and treatment.
*  Random urine screens.
*  Restitution set at ZERO.
*  No contact with the co-defendant Michael R Guerra or the address at 345 S. 116th Street, in the City of West Allis, Milwaukee County, Wisconsin.
*  MUST provide a DNA sample.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons.
*  Defendant shall not vote until civil rights are restored.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form
*  Two (2)  Letters

Defendant Matthew John Bittmann in court with attorney Adam C Essling.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms. No voting until civil rights are restored.  No possession nor use of any body armor.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 02.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-19-2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Adam C. Essling in court, defendant Matthew John Bittmann not in court, in custody.  Catelin Autumn Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Plea Hearing today, however, the parties are not ready to proceed.
Parties still under negotiations.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 04-17-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Matthew John Bittmann in court with attorney Adam Essling.  Catelin A. Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties request a projected plea hearing date.
Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 03-17-2014 at 1:30 PM for Projected Plea Hearing.

Defendant Matthew John Bittmann in court with attorney Adam Essling.  Catelin A. Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court grants state's motion to orally amend the last paragraph on Page 1 of the Criminal Complaint to read, "12-16-13" rather than "12-6-13."  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 02-13-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew John Bittmann in court with attorney Adam Essling as a friend of the Court.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1-20-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
